sentences: Istus kahe tooli vahel, suutmata valida, kas olla liberaalide või sotsiaaldemokraatide poolt.
Ühelt poolt on ta sotsiaalselt aktiivne, teiselt poolt tahab edukat äri ajada, sõnaga – istub lõputult kahe tooli vahel.
context: The word 'tooli' in Estonian is the genitive singular, partitive singular, and illative singular form of the noun 'tool', which means 'chair'. As shown in the dictionary definitions, it can be translated as 'of chair', 'from a chair', or 'to a chair' depending on the grammatical case. The phrase 'kahe tooli vahel' (between two chairs) is commonly used idiomatically to mean being indecisive or unable to choose between two positions, similar to the English expression 'sitting on the fence'.
